Pirnmill is served by the 324 bus service which is operated by Stagecoach
. All buses going to Brodick (except the 07:52 bus heading for Lamlash via Brodick) connect with the CalMac
ferry there. Timetables are available on board the CalMac ferries, on board the buses, at most convenience stores on the island and on the Stagecoach website.
The A841 coastal road passes through Pirnmill, as well as most other places on the island.
The best way to get around and explore the area is by foot. Cars can also be taken up the gravel track to the hamlet of Penrioch, which is about half a mile up the hill behind the village.
